title: 15 awesome gifts our editors recommend this year
text:
15 awesome gifts our editors recommend this year

Gifts our editors love 2019 (Photo: Staub and Jackson Ruckar/Reviewed)

— Our editors review and recommend products to help you buy the stuff you need. If you make a purchase by clicking one of our links, we may earn a small share of the revenue. However, our picks and opinions are independent from USA Today’s newsroom and any business incentives.

We’ve all been there before. You’re shopping online or wandering aimlessly through aisles and you find yourself completely at a loss. Family and friends can be picky, but let’s be real, you don’t want to be the person who just throws gift cards at everyone during the holidays. With some insight from our product experts, you’re sure to find a spark of inspiration for everyone on your gift list this year.

At Reviewed we’re looking at products year round, no matter if a holiday is coming up on the calendar. So when our editors were asked what they’re hoping to receive and what they’re planning on giving this holiday season, they didn’t hesitate to share.

1. For the home chef: Staub Dutch Oven

Gifts our editors love 2019: Staub Round Coccette (Photo: Staub)

A dutch oven is truly one of the most versatile items to have in your kitchen. From soups to bread to sautéing vegetables, it can pretty much do it all. Our photographer, Betsey Goldwasser, has had her eye on one for quite some time: “They’re truly the most beautiful and diverse objects in your kitchen." No matter who is on your list this year or what kind of cooking abilities they have, this is the perfect way to enhance their kitchen. This is especially true for someone who tends to cook a lot of food at once.

If you’re put off by the price tag on the Staub, we recommend the Lodge 4.5-Quart Round Dutch Oven, our top budget pick.

Get the Staub Cast Iron 5.5-Quart Round Cocotte on Amazon for $324.95

2. For the one who can’t function without coffee: Keurig K-Elite Coffee Maker

Gifts our editors love 2019: Keurig K Elite (Photo: Amazon / Keurig)

For most people out there, having a source of caffeine is vital to starting the day off on the right foot. Why venture out to buy coffee every morning when you can get a fresh brew right from your kitchen counter? Graphic designer Naidin Concul-Ticas can’t get enough of her Keurig coffee maker and plans on handing them out like candy this holiday season.

“Most of my family are coffee drinkers and always highly caffeinated so I'm excited to get them on the Keurig bandwagon,” she says. Easy to use, fast and also featuring an iced coffee option, this Keurig will help anyone get through the day with a little extra pep in their step.

Get the Keurig K-Elite Coffee Maker on Amazon for $124.99

3. For the one who already has everything: Squatty Potty

Gifts our editors love 2019: Squatty Potty (Photo: Squatty Potty)

I know what you’re thinking. This sounds like a pretty crappy gift. However, writer Shayna Murphy begs to differ. “Since working at Reviewed, I know that the Squatty Potty actually works, since we tested it. Plus, I'm a big fan of giving gifts that people will actually like and utilize, so it seems absolutely perfect for the holidays,” Murphy says. While it may not be the most glamorous gift of all time, it’s certainly useful. It might just be the number 1 way to go number 2.

Get the Squatty Potty on Amazon for $24.99

4. For the one who definitely isn’t a morning person: Philips Wake Up Alarm Clock

Gifts our editors love 2019: Philips Wake Up Alarm Clock (Photo: Philips)

Admit it, we all know someone who struggles to get up in the morning. Maybe it’s you, maybe it’s your spouse, maybe it’s one of your kids who just seems to take an eternity to finally rise to greet the day. Enter: the Philips Wake Up Light Alarm Clock.

Editor Meghan Kavanaugh received this as a gift last Christmas and it has been her favorite gift to date: “It’s the perfect gift for anyone who wants an easier wake up in the morning, which is probably everyone on your list.” With a simulated sun rise and the sound of birds chirping, it helps sleepers wake up gradually, far less abrupt than the alarm folks usually set on their phones.

Get the Philips Wake-Up Light Alarm Clock on Amazon for $115.18

5. For the music lover: JBL Flip 4 Bluetooth Speaker

Gifts our editors love 2019: JBL Flip 4 Bluetooth Speaker (Photo: Reviewed / Jackson Ruckar)

Though it may be small, the best Bluetooth speaker we’ve ever tested packs a powerful punch and our community manager, Lauren Rodalakis, has her eye on it for this holiday season. “I have finally reached a point in my life where my computer speakers aren't cutting it anymore when I want to play some pump-up music while I'm getting ready for the day,” she said.

And what more could you really ask for? It’s compact, waterproof and comes in plenty of different colors. Perfect for a private jam session or if you’re looking to take it on the go.

Get the JBL Flip 4 Waterproof Portable Bluetooth Speaker on Amazon for $89.95

6. For the one trying to kick their Starbucks habit: Nespresso Milk Frother

Gifts our editors love 2019: Nespresso Aeroccino Milk Frother (Photo: Reviewed / Betsey Goldwasser)

Editor Alicia Cyprus can’t emphasize enough how much this milk frother is a game-changer for coffee lovers. “It’s the simplest way any coffee drinker can elevate their morning routine,” she says. Not only is it the best milk frother we’ve ever tested, but it’s simple design ensure that you don’t have to have the skills of a barista to use it. If cherries came on top of morning coffee, this would be it.

Get the Nestle Nespresso Aeroccino3 Milk Frother on Amazon for $68.88

7. For the grill master: Hamilton Beach Searing Grill

Gifts our editors love 2019: Hamilton Beach Searing Grill (Photo: Hamilton Beach)

For some, the outdoor grilling season can be tragically cut short if they don’t live in a warm weather climate. However, this indoor grill is here to help. Editor Lee Neikirk can’t get enough of his: “I’ve grilled burgers, chicken, sausages, hot dogs—even asparagus and portobello mushrooms, and it’s all been grill-mark tasty.” The grill grate and dish tray are dishwasher safe, and it takes up minimal counter space—what’s not to love?

Get the Hamilton Beach Electric Indoor Searing Grill on Amazon for $64.99

8. For the pet parent: K9 Sport Sack

Gifts our editors love 2019: K9 Sport Sack (Photo: Jackson Ruckar/Reviewed)

After food, water, and a sturdy leash, the K9 Sport Sack is a must have for editor Amy Roberts and her pup, Gus. After trying multiple carriers for her 18-pound companion, Roberts knew the Sport Sack was the only thing that would work.

“Honestly, I recommend it to every city dog owner I meet (and we meet a lot of them!), as well as folks who like to hike with dogs that may not be able or willing to keep up all day long,” she says. The medium Sport Sack can hold dogs up to 30 pounds, ideal for making sure furry friends can take part in the action, no matter where their owner is headed.

Get the K9 Sport Sack on Amazon for $69.95

9. For the one who’s looking to get healthy: FitBit Charge 3

Gifts our editors love 2019: FitBit Charge 3 (Photo: Reviewed / Jackson Ruckar)

From the fitness fanatic to the desk-dweller, the FitBit Charge 3 is perfect for anyone looking to have a sleek option that will track their steps and give them a little reminder to get moving throughout the day. Social media manager Kate McCarthy has it at the top of her list for gifts to give this year. “It’s easy to set up and use, plus a great way to remind yourself to take a break and go for a walk during the day,” she says. Simple to use for even those who don’t consider themselves tech-savvy, the FitBit Charge 3 is like having a personal trainer on your wrist.

Get the FitBit Charge 3 on Amazon for $139.99

10. For the forgetful one: Parka in a Pocket

Gifts our editors love 2019: Parka in a Pocket (Photo: Amazon)

We’ve all been there before, going about the day and suddenly, a torrential rainstorm comes out of nowhere. While constantly carrying around an umbrella is out of the question, and covering your head with a trash bag is not an ideal look, the Parka in a Pocket is the next best thing.

“There have been several times I've left the office to a torrential downpour and been jacket-less, hoodless, and umbrella-less," says video producer Melissa Rorech. "But then I remember my Parka in a Pocket buried at the bottom of my bag. I whip it out, throw it on, and safely make it home, cozy and dry!” With a variety of sizes and colors, this jacket is ideal for pretty much anyone on your list, especially those who might not always have their eye on the weather forecast.

Get the Parka in a Pocket on Amazon for $35.78

11. For the one who wants to pamper themselves: Merkur Progress Safety Razor

Gifts our editors love 2019: Merkur Safety Razor (Photo: Reviewed / Betsey Goldwasser)

The one gift writer Mark Brezinski can’t recommend enough? The Merkur Progress safety razor. “It's really the only product I ever recommend, and I recommend it to literally anyone who shaves,” he says. With more control over your shave, this razor ensures you get a closer shave as well as fewer nicks and cuts. Best of all, over time, this saves tons of money—especially if someone is used to using disposable razors.

Get the Merkur Progress Adjustable 2-Piece Double Edge Safety Razor on Amazon for $58.20

12. For the person who needs a little energy boost: Nespresso Creatista Plus

Gifts our editors love 2019: Nespresso Creatista Plus (Photo: Reviewed / Betsey Goldwasser)

Looking to share the gift of caffeine this holiday season? Look no further. Editor Cindy Bailen’s espresso maker is one of her favorite kitchen appliances, and she thinks it’s a great addition to any kitchen, especially one where someone is in need of a little energy boost. Since this machine takes pods, it’s easy to try a different flavor every morning, and when we tested the Nespresso Creatista, it was so easy to use; you didn’t even have to open the manual to understand it. Talk about a win-win.

If you’re put off by the price on the Breville, we recommend the DeLonghi Nespresso Lattissima Plus.

Get the Nespresso Creatista Plus by Breville on Amazon for $411.56

13. For the one who always wants the latest gadget: Cuisinart Air Fryer

Gifts our editors love 2019: Cuisinart Air Fryer (Photo: Reviewed / Jackson Ruckar)

The latest craze in kitchen appliances that seems like it won’t be leaving anytime soon? Air fryers. “I see recipes all over social media for air-fried food and it looks so delicious,” says audience development manager Rachel Moskowitz, who has been dropping hints to her family that this should be on their shopping lists. Unlike most air fryers, this one has a wider basket, ensuring food can be spread out yielding to crisper and more even results. Homemade french fries? Crispy onion rings? Yes, please.

Get the Cuisinart AFR-25 Air Fryer on Amazon for $82.70

14. For the tea lover: Zojirushi Water Boiler and Warmer

Gifts our editors love 2019: Zojirushi Hot Water Dispenser and Boiler (Photo: Zojirushi)

Enough about coffee, let’s give some love to all the tea drinkers out there. “As someone who loves tea, I find it frustrating to have to re-heat the water boiler over and over again and then have to wait till the water cools down to the desired temperature for tea,” writer Valerie Li says. Hence, why the Zojirushi water boiler is at the top of her gift list this year.

The large, 4-liter water tank allows for endless cups of tea throughout the day, plus it also have multiple warm temperature settings. Best of all, tea drinkers can whip up a cup and then take it on the go with the best travel mug we’ve ever tested, also from Zojirushi.

Get the Zojirushi Hybrid Water Boiler and Warmer on Amazon for $186.65

15. For the chef with limited space: Ninja Fit Personal Blender

Gifts our editors love 2019: Ninja Fit Personal Blender (Photo: Reviewed.com/Jackson Ruckar)

Ah, the trusty kitchen blender. No matter what kind of culinary skills a person has, we can all agree on one thing: It's pretty much the easiest appliance to use. Editor Anna Lane has her eye on the best blender we’ve ever tested this holiday season. “I make smoothies for myself and my kids almost every morning and a full-size blender is a pain to clean every day,” she says. Not too big and powerful, yet not too small and weak, the Ninja Fit blender is truly the Goldilocks when it comes to personal blenders—just right.

Get the Ninja Fit Personal Blender on Amazon for $49.99

The product experts at Reviewed have all your shopping needs covered this holiday season. Follow Reviewed on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram for the latest deals, reviews, and more.

Prices were accurate at the time this article was published but may change over time.
